WRITING.TITLE: You are the next level door
WRITING.TEXT: This is based on a concept I saw here a little while ago, but could not find the source (so can not credit it). In short you play as The Door, a sentient being whose sole purpose is to find the incompetent protagonist and help them advance to the next level. You would still need to battle enemies and collect any keys/gems required to open yourself to let the protagonist through, but can throw enemies forward and deal with them later too (sort of a commentary of life, that you deal with issues now or they pile up later). While a sidescroller/platformer might be fun, I am instead taking inspiration from 2D top down rouge like games. I've thrown together a [quick little demo](http://aedendalessandro.com.au/games/Door%20Hero/index.html) or what could be achieved, and would like peoples input.

"You alright ? What's on your mind ?", Frank asks as we stroll down the main street. I stop, and look right at him for a second, before saying "Well, recently I became aware that I have the ability to quicksave before saying something that would prove devistating when talking with others." "Well, that has to be the stupidest thing you've ever said !", said Frank, as he shook his head. "There's no way that can be true." "I swear it is ! Why would I make it up ?", I ask, not expecting an aswer from Frank. "Well, if that is true, and you are quicksaving before saying something that will be devistating; then prove it.", Frank insisted. Rolling my eyes, I say "I've tried proving it, again and again; when I reload though you never remember, because foryou this conversation hasn't happened yet." "So you've tried telling me this before ?", Frank asked, this time with genuine curiousity. "Yeah, and everytime we go through similar conversation loops.", I say with a heavy sigh. "Then prove it. What am I about to say ?", Frank and I say at the same time. "Hey ! How'd you do that ?", we say in unison. "Purple monkey dish washer !", he says, with me trailing just behind. A horrified look washes over his face as the realisation sets in. "You're not lying are you ?", he says, stammering as he does so. "Why would I ?", I ask him, knowng he will not reply with an answer. Thinking for a moment, Frank says "If you know everything, that means there is no free choice as you know the choices people will make. That means that this is just all some elaborate simulation working it's way through a preset sequence." "Now calm down Frank. There's no need to panic. Don't do anything rash !", I say, trying to talk him out of the rash action he's about to take. "I don't want to live in a world like that !", he cries out as he runs into the oncomming traffic. With a screech of brakes, that come too late, followed by shrieks from my friend; I know there's only one thing I can do. **RELOAD** "Huh ? What did you say ?, I ask, staring at Frank. "I ask if everything was alright, and if there was somethin on your mind.", he says. I pause for a moment, considering my response before saying "Yeah, everythings cool. I was just wondering if you might like to go for an ice cream, my shout." "That's probably the smartest thing you've ever said.", he says with a smile. I look at him, sigh, and smile back. Maybe one day I'll be able to tell him, without hm fresking out; as for now, I guess I'll just have to settle with ice cream.

"That doesn't sound right.", Jason said, checking the information out for himself. Surely enough though, there on his retinal display showed the fact that not only at one point was the President of the United States a non famous television personality; but prior to 2017 all but one weren't famous for their television or movie roles prior to being President. Still confusedal as to how such a system would have worked, he asked his teacher for more information. "It may be hard to believe Jason, but before President Trump, people would vote on the policies and promises those running for government would make.", said the teacher, smiling as she had explained this foreign concept many times. "What about this Lincoln guy ? It says here he died while at the theatre.", Jason enquired. "He was watching a performance. He was not the one being watched.", replied the teacher. "That's crazy !", came Jason's reply, still unable to believe such things were the norm. "Worry not though, after President Minaj was elected in 2022, after the impeachment of disgraced President Winfrey gave away two thirds of the country during an address at the United Nations; it was decided that only the most famous and relevant would be allowed to run for public office.", explained the teacher. "Oh, you mean the thirty-second amendment ?", Jason guessed, hoping he had been paying enough attention in class that day. "Close, but it was the thirty-first amendment. Guess someone needs some more study.", Jason's teacher said, pointing at the tablet in front of him. "I guess so.", Jason said, sheepishly. Smiling, she left him to study on his own. It was not long however, before one of the other students yelled out for the teachers attention, asking "Miss, what's this about the great dinosaur war of 2033 ?"

WRITING.TITLE: Another 48GB download ?
WRITING.TEXT: So after a 50GB download to play the game (even if you bought it on disc), we now have a 48GB patch ? Not even two weeks into the game, and you need to download the whole thing all over again essentially? There's people here in Australia in rural regions who have yet to even finish download the first file, as their speeds are less than 1MB/sec. I could have sworn they had a BETA to iron out the kinks. The worst part is I genuinely love all of Bethesda's works. I've bought all their games (in some cases multiple times on multiple consoles), but after this; I feel I will just wait six months after any future launches sadly.

Regardless of what they tell you, size does matter. Especially during an update. Unless they are literally redesigning the whole world, giving us all 8K textures, and building in a whole new engine; I feel this size is inexcusable.
Because I live 1KM past the metro/regional area, I don't get a choice. And yeah maybe the next will only be 40GB :p
I know the initial download was for the game, but that should have been on the disc, like it was with Fallout 4
I meant the latter, my phone however thought it would be fun to autocorrect.

This sort of thing also hurts the developers too sadly, as I believe they are billed for each download for the use of Sony's service. (I may be wrong, but one of my device friends explained this a while back).
I know that the game needs patching, but it's the sheer size that is the issue. I'd not care if they did 50 1GB updates, as then you could still actually play the game.

WRITING.TEXT: My guess so your mirrors may not be aligned properly. Put a piece of painters tape over the second mirror (X-Axis), and set the laser to 0% power and slowly move up by 1% until you see a mark, then adjust the mirror from the previous one and have it so it is in the centre. Repeat this for your Y-Axis too. Make sure to test at the nearest and furthest points. Aligning the mirrors can improve power output at the head significantly, and reduce any misfires at higher power levels.

It is, but the value of the raw metals meant melting the coin down would have given a 25% profit vs the face value of the coin.

At any one time the face value of a coin should not be less than 1.5 times the value of the materials required to make it. So a 10c coin for example should cost at maximum 6.67c to make. Otherwise it starts getting to the point where citizens will smelt the coins. This is what happened with the round Australian 50c piece, and promoted the change in metals. While they were at it they made it a dodecahedron too.

Nope, it starts from the date of complaint. So long as that was within 30 days of receiving the item you're fine. Also, PayPal has 180 days of buyer protection.

So long as you were in communication you're fine. Raise a complaint now with eBay so you are doubly covered. Just state the product is not as described, explain why postage back is impossible due to overseas costs (I'm guessing it came from China) and then tell them you would like a refund and if the seller wants the laser back they can come pick it up. I'm not sure how your countries consumer Law works (I only know Australia's) but most have a guarantee to protect you (the buyer) from being sold dangerous or misleading items by them (the seller/vendor).

For the love of God, allign each mirror before you start. Don't assume it is already done. Clean your lenses frequently. Always make sure the pump is running bedore you start the laser going. Start with easy things first; a square, a circle, a triangle. This way you will learn how to make shapes work. And finally, run a test pattern.

Lenses and mirrors I should say. And just make a simple test pattern, 1cm x 1cm squares, with filled circles every 5. This will help you know if you have ay weak spot or defects in your bed; or if you need realigning.

And that's fine. But I would not categorise it as a book everyone has to read.

Primarily, yes. I'm not trying to diminish it's importance, however as the question was "What book should everyone read once in their life ?", I feel in order to learn the lesson of the book, there are others that do it much better. And that is all I will say on the matter.

I always enjoy finding the lower level players and just handing over any extra recipes or plans. I mean I could sell them for like 10 caps, or I could let someone start building their character and CAMP.

If the laser is over five years, put some money aside for a new tube. I bought a second hand unit (3 months old) on behalf of a work colleague. I went to go check it out, did some tests and checked out. Paid AU$349 for it compared to AU$550 for a new one from Sydney. Unit works great, needs an alignment. What I would say, take a test (cut, etch, raster) file with you, set the power to 10-15% and see how it cuts. Just know when you get it home, you'll need to align the mirrors. If you're happy, I'd say pay half the price of a brand new unit, no more than that.
